oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ostrich Production
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Thornberry, Fred D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ed. Note: Although jew readerslikely keep ostriches, the husbandrymethods described herein are excellentand very applicable to mosttypes of birds, with some modifications.This article provides astep-by-step approach to soundmanagement of any bird flock.Though all of us are familiar withostriches in zoos, commercial ostrichfarms have been in the United Statesfor many years, especially when theirfeathers were popular.Since the recent restriction ofostrich importation from southAfrica, the demand for ostriches isvery high, resulting in high prices forall ages of birds.Successful large-scale productiondepends on implementing scientificallyproven practices in managementand husbandry, breeding, broodingand rearing, nutrition, health maintenanceand, above all, hatcherymanagement and incubation. Maximumutilization of quality forage willlikely be necessary to make productioneconomically feasible.
